alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 4:09PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cherokee County through 445 PM CDT... At 409 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cedar Bluff, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Centre Municipal Airport, Gaylesville, Cornwall Furnace Park, Eastern Weiss Lake, Western Weiss Lake, Broomtown, Fullerton, Howells Crossroads and Waterhouse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
